Option J: BB × BB. Both parents are BB, so all offspring are BB, resulting in 100% black. Doesn't fit.

Option C: bb × Bb. Parent 1 is bb (white) and parent 2 is Bb (can produce B and b). Offspring will be 50% Bb (brown) and 50% bb (white). Again, 50:50, which doesn't fit.

Option E: bb × BB. As above, same as C, 50% brown, 50% white.

Option D: bb × bb. All offspring are bb, so all white. Doesn't fit.

Thus, the only viable option that leads to a 3:1 ratio (75% black, 25% white) without any parent being white is option F: Bb × bb.
</think>
The correct answer is F
